definition[0]: the system or type of money used in a country
example[0]: the gold coinage of the Roman empire
definition[1]: a word or phrase that has been recently invented
example[1]: The phrase ‘glass ceiling’ is a fairly recent coinage.
definition[2]: the invention of new words or phrases
definition[4]: the system of coins used in a country
example[2]: Britain did not use decimal coinage until 1971.
definition[5]: money in the form of coins
example[3]: substantial amounts of silver and gold coinage
